channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KY

item.title: Report X-2023081371
item.description:
Report X-2023081371

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-14T15:12:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-10
  • City: WALTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RECIEVED CALL SAYING THERE WAS A LEAKER IN THE IRREG BELT. RESPONDER SAW THAT IT WAS A HAZMAT. RESPONDER USED DECISION TREE AND PUT ON THE PROPER PPE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. RESPONDER TRANSPORTED PACKAGE BACK TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

  • Description: The dome lid on the KAG Specialty Products Group, LLC trailer was not secured tightly. This allowed approximately 1 gallon of Circular Pyrolysis Oil to be released. Hepaco Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report X-2023080872
item.description:
Report X-2023080872

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-10
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking. QA was called and package was picked up, package was put into a lined tote and spill pads were used to clean up leaked product. DescribePack: Caps came loose on two bottles during transit causing internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Caps were replaced and tightened and package was kept in an upright position.

item.title: Report X-2023080851
item.description:
Report X-2023080851

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-10
  • City: PADUCAH
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: 53ft trailer was being unloaded when in the middle of trailer it was discovered that the Hazmat was on top of two packages in the middle of the trailer buried. Package was called for leaking and package was isolated with a non leak tote and a sweep of the trailer for residual. Package was then brought to the QA cage for inspection to identify the cause. DescribePack: Failure was due to one of the four gallon containers of Ethanol solutions that had a leaking cap that lose a quart of solution. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was communicated when discovered with a prepped non leak tote with a hazmat bag already lined. Package was shortly removed from unload with other Admins checking the trailer for hazard while the package was being seperated.

item.title: Report X-2023080843
item.description:
Report X-2023080843

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-09
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The cap on one of the bottles came loose and an internal leakage resulted. Upon being discovered, the item was brought to QA to be worked on. DescribePack: One of the bottles had a loose cap. Due to the corrosive nature of the contents, the contents were protruding out of the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The item was placed in a spill tote to prevent further leakage.

item.title: Report X-2023080816
item.description:
Report X-2023080816

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-09
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A package handler dropped the package causing a cap to become loose and a spill. We use neutralizer to clean up spilled product and secured the package and soiled clean up materials in a lined red tote DescribePack: Cap became loose DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a lined red tote.

item.title: Report X-2023080914
item.description:
Report X-2023080914

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-19
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE QA STATION AND UPON INSPECTION IT WAS FOUND THAT THE CORROSIVE CONTENT HAD BEGUN TO LEAK DUE TO A LOOSE CAP WHICH MAY HAVE BEEN CAUSED BY THE LACK OF PROTECTION FOR THE CONTENTS. DescribePack: LOOSE CAP DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: CONTENTS WAS PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG AND THEN PLACED IN A HAZMAT DRUN
